head.supplied: Botanic Garden Sydney ¶ 7th January 1857 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ Having been informed by Dr Muller that in consequence of certain instructions from the Home Government, he is precluded from parting with any of the...

div.p: From Charles Moore to Alfred Denison
MS Q426 inward correspondence, Gregory papers, Dixson Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

Transcribed 23.12.92. To be proof read at Mitchell Library.
MS annotation by W. T. Denison: 'If Dr Mueller has any seeds to share it would be very desirable that a few should be given of each kind to the Botanic Garden here where they will have better chance of vegetating than in England — will Mr Gregory be good enough to see to this | WD 8 June '57'. Botanic Garden Sydney

Having been informed by Dr Muller that in consequence of certain instructions from the Home Government, he is precluded from parting with any of the seeds collected by him during the progress of the North Australian Expedition which has just terminated. I do myself the honor to request, that you will have the goodness to draw the attention of His Excellency the Governor General to this matter, in the hope that some means may be devised for securing a small portion of these valuable seeds for the benefit of this establishment
